org.relationlearn.filters

Class SequentialFilterGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.relationlearn.filters.SequentialFilterGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FilterGroup

    public class SequentialFilterGroup
extends Object
implements FilterGroup
    Implementation of FilterGroup which applies the TextFilter objects to the input in the same order they were added to group and in a sequential manner.

    Configuration file options

    Apart adding filters through code you can also supply an XML file which will contain your desired filter configuration to be used wihtout adding them manually by code.
    The code below is an example of all the possible input formats: 

     <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
 <filters>
     <filter id="1" local="yes" relative="no" 
         classpath="file:/C:/your/absolute/path/here">
     class.fully.qualified.name
     </filter>
     <filter id="4" local="yes" relative="yes" 
         classpath="your/relative/path/here">
      class.fully.qualified.name
      <filter_params>
          <param>your_param_value_here</param>
      <filter_params>
     </filter>
     <filter id="3" local="no" classpath="your_url_here">
      class.fully.qualified.name
     </filter>
 </filters>

    You can basically have two types of filter configurations: local filters and remote filters. Local filters can then be found using a relative path or an absolute path, both Windows and Linux path separators work directly with this system, so only you need to input the path the same way the system represents it.

    For remote paths your path is the URL addres where the base directory for the sources or the .jar file are located.

    The id attribute only defines the priority of the filter being Integer.MIN_VALUE the one with the hightest priority and Integer.MAX_VALUE the value with less priority. Although its recommended that you begin identifying your filters with the value 1 for the first, 2 for the second and so on.

    Additionally if the TextFilter you want to load accepts additional parameters , you can supply them inside the filter_params tag as shown in the example with id=4.

    Important Note: Keep in mind that the only parameters you can supply to the TextFilter using a config file will be of type String so build your TextFilter with that in mind. For example you could provide a constructor that accepts a List and the implement another one which accepts as paramter the path to that same list serialized in a file for its use with this configuration file.

    See Also:
    URLClassLoader, FilterGroup, TextFilter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SequentialFilterGroup()
      Constructs a SequentialFilterGroup with the dataset name "test-dataset" without any filter added.
      SequentialFilterGroup(String dataset)
      Constructs a SequentialFilterGroup with the dataset name dataset without any filter added.
      SequentialFilterGroup(String dataset, File configFile)
      Constructs a SequentialFilterGroup with the dataset name dataset, and, using the information found in configFile, loads all specified TextFilter objects and adds them to this SequentialFilterGroup.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addClassAttribute(Attribute attr)
      Adds the Attribute attr as the Instances class attribute or sets the Instances class value to RelationClass.DEFAULT_CLASS.
      void addFilter(TextFilter filter)
      Adds a new TextFilter to the FilterGroup.
      Instance createInstanceUsingFilters(String r, String h)
      Generates an Instance object by applying all the TextFilter elements contained in the FilterGroup to the input parameters provided.
      FastVector getGroupAttributes()
      Returns a FastVector instance containing all the Attribute elements of this FilterGroup, this Attribute elements are the one's each Instace generated with the method createInstanceUsingFilters must have.
      Instances getGroupDataset()
      Returns the current dataset for this FilterGroup.
      String getGroupDatasetName()
      Returns the dataset name for this FilterGroup.

        dataset - the name of this SequentialFilterGroup dataset
        configFile - the XML file whioh contains the filter configuration to load onto this SequentialFilterGroup
